residence_in_india.description: This section defines the criteria for determining whether an individual, Hindu Undivided Family (HUF), firm, association of persons (AOP), or company is considered a resident in India for a given previous year.

eligibility_criteria: Determines residency status based on time spent in India and the control and management of affairs.
Specifies conditions for individuals, HUFs, firms, AOPs, BOIs, and companies.
individual_residency: Resident if in India for 182 days or more in a year.
Resident if in India for 60 days or more and 365 days in the previous four years.
exceptions_for_individual: Indian citizens leaving India for employment or as members of crew are treated as residents if they meet the extended stay criteria.
Indian citizens visiting India with income exceeding ₹15 lakh will have different stay criteria.
huf_and_firm_residency: A Hindu undivided family, firm, or AOP is considered resident unless the control and management of affairs are outside India.
company_residency: An Indian company is automatically considered a resident.
A company is considered resident if its place of effective management is in India.
not_ordinarly_resident_criteria: Non-resident for 9 out of 10 previous years or 729 days in the last 7 years.
Income exceeding ₹15 lakh and spent between 120 and 182 days in India qualifies for non-ordinary residency.
income_from_foreign_sources: Income derived from outside India, excluding business controlled or profession set up in India.

individual_residency_criteria.condition: An individual is considered resident if they stay in India for 182 days or more during the year.
An individual is also considered resident if they stay in India for 60 days or more and have been in India for 365 days in the last 4 years.

exceptions.condition: Indian citizens leaving India for employment or as crew members are treated as residents if they fulfill extended stay requirements.
Indian citizens visiting India with income exceeding ₹15 lakh have a modified stay requirement of 120-182 days.

huf_and_firm_residency.condition: A Hindu undivided family, firm, or AOP is considered resident if its control and management are in India.

company_residency_criteria.condition: An Indian company is considered resident. If a company's place of effective management is in India, it is considered a resident.

not_ordinarly_resident_criteria.condition: A non-resident for 9 out of 10 previous years or in India for 729 days or less in the last 7 years qualifies as not ordinarily resident.
An individual with income over ₹15 lakh who stays in India for 120-182 days qualifies as not ordinarily resident.

income_from_foreign_sources_definition.definition: Income from foreign sources means income that arises outside India, except income from businesses controlled or professions set up in India.

income_deemed_to_be_received.description: This section defines certain incomes that are deemed to be received by an individual in the previous year, even if the individual has not actually received them. It covers accretion to the balance of recognized provident funds, transferred balances, and contributions under the pension scheme under section 80CCD.

deemed_incomes: Accretion to recognized provident fund balance.
Transferred balance in a recognized provident fund.
Contribution by the Central Government or employer to pension scheme under section 80CCD.
provident_fund_details: Accretion to balance in a recognized provident fund is deemed to be received.
Transferred balance refers to the balance moved from one provident fund to another.
pension_scheme_contribution: Contributions made by the Central Government or any other employer to an employee's pension scheme under section 80CCD are deemed to be received.

deemed_incomes.condition: The annual accretion to the balance in a recognized provident fund is deemed to be received, subject to conditions under rule 6 of Part A of the Fourth Schedule.
The transferred balance in a recognized provident fund is deemed to be received, as specified in sub-rule (4) of rule 11 of Part A of the Fourth Schedule.
The contribution made by the Central Government or any other employer to an employee's account under a pension scheme referred to in section 80CCD is deemed to be received.

income_deemed_to_accrue_or_arise_in_indi.description: Section 9 defines situations where income is deemed to accrue or arise in India, even if it is not physically received within the country. It covers various categories of income like income from business or profession, property, and certain specific types of income derived from sources outside India.

deemed_income_sources: Income from business or profession carried out in India.
Income from property situated in India.
Income from royalties or fees for technical services arising in India.
exclusions: Income not deemed to accrue or arise in India if not connected to India.

deemed_income_sources.condition: Income from business or profession carried out in India is deemed to accrue or arise in India, irrespective of whether it is received in India or not.
Income from property situated in India is deemed to accrue or arise in India.
Income from royalties or fees for technical services that arise in India, even if the recipient is a non-resident, is deemed to accrue or arise in India.

exclusions.condition: Income that is not connected to India and is earned outside India, or not sourced from Indian property or activities, is not deemed to accrue or arise in India.

salaries_income.description: Section 15 outlines the types of income that shall be chargeable to income-tax under the head 'Salaries'. It includes any salary due, paid, or allowed by the employer, including arrears, and defines specific provisions for advance payments and salary to partners in a firm.

chargeable_income_types: Salary paid or allowed before it became due
exclusions: Salary paid to partner of a firm

chargeable_income.condition: Any salary that is due from an employer or a former employer to the assessee in the previous year, whether paid or not, is chargeable to income-tax.

chargeable_income.type: Salary Paid or Allowed in Advance
chargeable_income.condition: Any salary paid or allowed in the previous year by or on behalf of an employer or a former employer, even if it is not due or before it becomes due, is chargeable to income-tax.

Any arrears of salary paid or allowed in the previous year by or on behalf of an employer or a former employer, if it was not charged to income-tax for any earlier previous year, is chargeable to income-tax.
Any bonus, commission, or remuneration, by whatever name called, that is due to, or received by the assessee in the previous year is chargeable to income-tax under the head 'Salaries'.
If any salary is paid in advance and included in the total income for any previous year, it shall not be included again when the salary becomes due.

exclusions.condition: Any salary, bonus, commission, or remuneration due to or received by a partner of a firm from the firm shall not be regarded as 'salary' for the purposes of Section 15.

detailed_explanation.description: Any salary that is due from the employer or a former employer in the previous year, regardless of whether it has been paid, will be considered chargeable under this section. This applies even if the salary is not yet paid but has been earned and is due.

detailed_explanation.type: Salary Paid or Allowed in Advance
detailed_explanation.description: Salary that is paid or allowed before it becomes due or even though it was not due in the previous year is chargeable to income-tax. This could include prepayments or early salary disbursements.
Arrears of salary that were due in earlier years but were not included in those years' income-tax filings are chargeable to income-tax in the year they are paid or allowed.
Any income received under the name of bonus, commission, or remuneration, regardless of how it is named, is included under the head 'Salaries' and is chargeable to income-tax.
If any salary is paid in advance in one year and included in the total income for that year, it will not be included in the total income again when the salary becomes due in a subsequent year.

deductions_from_salaries.description: Section 16 outlines the deductions that can be made from an individual's income chargeable under the head 'Salaries' to compute the taxable salary. It includes deductions for certain specified amounts, entertainment allowance, tax on employment, and other allowances granted by the employer.

deductions: Deduction for salary or Rs. 50,000, whichever is less

deductions.condition: A deduction of fifty thousand rupees or the amount of salary, whichever is less, is allowed.

A deduction is allowed in respect of any allowance in the nature of entertainment allowance granted by an employer to an assessee in receipt of a salary from the Government, equal to one-fifth of salary or five thousand rupees, whichever is less.
A deduction is allowed for any sum paid by the assessee on account of a tax on employment, as levied under Article 276 of the Constitution.

amendment_provision.description: A new proviso is added by the Finance (No. 2) Act, 2024, effective from 1st April 2025. It increases the deduction limit under clause (ia) of Section 16 from fifty thousand rupees to seventy-five thousand rupees if income-tax is computed under Section 115BAC.

detailed_explanation.description: This deduction allows an amount up to fifty thousand rupees (or the amount of salary, whichever is less) to be deducted from the total income chargeable under the head 'Salaries'. This deduction ensures that individuals with a relatively low salary have a greater tax relief.

This deduction is available only to Government employees receiving entertainment allowance. The deduction is the lesser of one-fifth of their salary (excluding other allowances or benefits) or five thousand rupees.

This allows the assessee to claim a deduction for any sum paid as a tax on employment, as per the provisions of Article 276 of the Indian Constitution, which is a tax levied by state governments on the employment of workers.

salary.definition: Salary includes wages, annuities, pensions, gratuities, fees, commissions, perquisites, profits in lieu of salary, advances of salary, payments for leave not availed, contributions to provident funds, government pension contributions, and contributions to the Agniveer Corpus Fund.

perquisite.definition: Perquisite includes benefits and amenities provided by the employer to the employee, including rent-free accommodation, accommodations at concessional rates, free or concessional benefits, employer-paid expenses, insurance premiums, specified securities, and sweat equity shares.

profits_in_lieu_of_salary.definition: Profits in lieu of salary include any compensation received upon termination or modification of employment, payments from provident or other funds (excluding employee contributions), and amounts due before or after employment ends.

definitions.user: Any person who accesses or avails any computer resource of an online gaming intermediary
definitions.user_account: Account of a user registered with an online gaming intermediary

subsections.title: Payments to contractors

deduction_of_tax.applicability: At the time of credit of sum to contractor's account or at the time of payment (whichever is earlier)

applicability_conditions.crediting_to_account: Tax applies when credited to contractor’s account
applicability_conditions.payment_modes: Cash, cheque, draft, or any other mode

crediting_to_suspense_account.description: If sum is credited to a suspense account, it is deemed credited to the contractor’s account, and tax deduction provisions apply

tax_deduction_rules.if_material_value_separated: Deduct tax on invoice value excluding material cost
tax_deduction_rules.if_material_value_not_separated: Deduct tax on the whole invoice value

personal_purposes_exemption.applicability: No tax deduction for sums credited or paid for personal purposes of individual or Hindu undivided family

threshold_for_deduction.amount_limit: No tax deduction if the sum does not exceed ₹30,000, unless aggregate exceeds ₹1,00,000 during the financial year

goods_carriage_exemption.applicability: No tax deduction for contractors owning 10 or fewer goods carriages and providing declaration with PAN

reporting_requirements.for_goods_carriage_contractors: The person responsible for payment must furnish details to the prescribed income-tax authority

entities_included: Corporations established by Central, State, or Provincial Acts
Individuals/HUF with sales exceeding ₹1 crore or profession exceeding ₹50 lakh

work_includes: Carriage of goods/passengers (other than by railways)
Manufacturing or supplying a product according to customer’s specifications
work_exclusions: Manufacturing or supplying products using material not purchased from the customer or their associate

subsections.title: Rent

deduction_of_tax.applicability: At the time of credit of income to payee's account or at the time of payment (whichever is earlier)

exemption_threshold.individual_huf_exemption: No deduction if the total income credited or paid does not exceed ₹240,000 during the financial year
exemption_threshold.business_exemption: No deduction if the individual/HUF's turnover exceeds ₹1 crore for business or ₹50 lakh for profession in the preceding financial year

deduction_of_tax.business_trust_exemption: No deduction if the rent is paid to a business trust (REIT) for real estate assets owned directly by the trust, as per section 10(23FCA)

rent.description: Any payment made for the use of (either separately or together) any land, building (including factory building), land appurtenant to a building (including factory building), machinery, plant, equipment, furniture, or fittings, under any lease, sub-lease, tenancy, or any other agreement

crediting_to_suspense_account.description: If income is credited to any suspense account, it is considered credited to the payee's account, and tax deduction provisions apply

subsections.title: Fees for Professional or Technical Services

deduction_of_tax.applicability: At the time of credit of sum to the payee's account or at the time of payment (whichever is earlier)

exemption_threshold.professional_services: No deduction if sum does not exceed ₹30,000 for professional services
exemption_threshold.technical_services: No deduction if sum does not exceed ₹30,000 for technical services
exemption_threshold.royalty: No deduction if sum does not exceed ₹30,000 for royalty
exemption_threshold.other_sums: No deduction if sum does not exceed ₹30,000 for any other sum referred to in clause (d) of section 28

deduction_of_tax.business_trust_exemption: No deduction for individual/HUF if total sales or turnover exceed ₹1 crore for business or ₹50 lakh for profession in the preceding financial year
deduction_of_tax.personal_purpose_exemption: No deduction if fees are paid exclusively for personal purposes of individual/HUF

special_conditions.call_center: For payee engaged only in the business of operation of a call center, tax rate is 2% instead of 10%

professional_services.description: Services rendered by persons in professions like legal, medical, engineering, architectural, accountancy, technical consultancy, interior decoration, advertising, or any other profession notified by the Board

fees_for_technical_services.description: Has the same meaning as in Explanation 2 to clause (vii) of sub-section (1) of section 9

royalty.description: Has the same meaning as in Explanation 2 to clause (vi) of sub-section (1) of section 9

crediting_to_suspense_account.description: If sum is credited to any suspense account or other accounts, it is considered credited to the payee's account, and the tax deduction provisions apply

subsections.title: Return of Income
Mandatory Filing
subsections.description: Specifies who is required to mandatorily file their income tax return based on income thresholds and other conditions.

subsections.title: Belated Return
subsections.description: Allows filing of a belated return if the original due date is missed, subject to time limits and late filing fees.

subsections.title: Revised Return
subsections.description: Permits revision of a previously filed return to correct any omission or wrong statement, within the prescribed time.

subsections.title: Updated Return
subsections.description: Enables filing of an updated return within 24 months from the end of the relevant assessment year, with additional tax liability.

subsections.title: Defective Return
subsections.description: Specifies conditions under which a return is treated as defective and the process to rectify such defects within a time frame.

subsections.title: Return by whom to be verified
subsections.description: Specifies who is authorized to verify the return of income under Section 115WD or Section 139, based on the type of taxpayer.

verification_by: The individual himself
If absent from India – by the individual or duly authorized person with power of attorney
If mentally incapacitated – by guardian or competent person
If otherwise unable – by a duly authorized person with power of attorney
Karta
If Karta is absent or mentally incapacitated – any other adult member
Managing Director
If unavailable – any director or prescribed person
If company is non-resident – person holding valid power of attorney (attached with return)
If under liquidation – liquidator (u/s 178)
If under government control – principal officer
If under IBC proceedings – insolvency professional
Managing Partner
If unavailable – any other partner (not a minor)
Designated Partner
If unavailable – any partner or prescribed person
Principal Officer
Chief Executive Officer (by any name/designation)
Any member or principal officer
That person or a competent person acting on their behalf

subsections.title: Assessment

(a).title: Computation of total income or loss

subclauses.(i): Any arithmetical error in the return
subclauses.(ii): An incorrect claim, if such incorrect claim is apparent from any information in the return
subclauses.(iii): Disallowance of loss claimed due to late filing of return for previous year
subclauses.(iv): Disallowance of expenditure or increase in income as per audit report not considered in return
subclauses.(v): Disallowance of deduction under section 10AA or Chapter VI-A for late returns
subclauses.(vi): Addition of income from Form 26AS/Form 16A/Form 16 not included in return

provisos: No such adjustments unless intimation is given to assessee
Consider response from assessee before adjustment
No adjustment under (vi) for AY from 1 April 2018

clauses.(b): Computation of tax, interest, and fee based on (a)
clauses.(c): Determine payable or refundable amount after adjustments
clauses.(d): Preparation and sending of intimation to assessee
provisos: Intimation required if loss adjusted but no tax/refund
No intimation after 9 months from end of FY in which return is made

(a).definition: Incorrect claim apparent from information in return

subpoints.(i): Item inconsistent with another item in return
subpoints.(ii): Information to support claim not furnished

explanation.(b): Acknowledgement deemed intimation if no tax/refund and no adjustment

subsections.(1A): Scheme for centralized processing of returns by Board
subsections.(1B): Govt. may notify exceptions/modifications to provisions for centralized processing
subsections.(1C): Notification and scheme to be laid before Parliament

(1D).rule: Processing not necessary if notice under (2) issued
(1D).proviso: Not applicable to returns from AY 1 April 2017 onwards

(2).title: Notice for scrutiny
(2).rule: AO may serve notice requiring evidence
(2).proviso: No notice after 3 months from end of FY in which return is furnished

(3).title: Assessment order after notice under (2)
(3).rule: AO assesses income/loss and determines tax/refund

provisos.condition: No assessment unless Govt. informed and approval withdrawn or notification rescinded
No assessment without withdrawal order from Principal Commissioner or Commissioner
If university/college/institution under 35(1)(ii)/(iii) violates conditions, Govt. may withdraw approval

(3A).title: Govt. may notify scheme for assessment under (3) or 144
objectives: Optimize resources via scale and specialization
Introduce team-based assessment with dynamic jurisdiction

subsections.title: Best Judgment Assessment

conditions.(a): Fails to file return under section 139(1) and has not filed a return under 139(4), 139(5), or updated return under 139(8A)
conditions.(b): Fails to comply with notice under section 142(1) or direction under section 142(2A)
conditions.(c): Fails to comply with notice under section 143(2) despite having filed return

(1).action: Assessing Officer shall assess income/loss to the best of their judgment after considering all relevant materials and giving the assessee an opportunity of being heard
provisos: AO shall serve a notice specifying date and time for hearing before making best judgment assessment
No need to provide such opportunity if a notice under section 142(1) was already issued before making the assessment

(2).rule: Pre-1988 law applies to assessment year 1988–89 and earlier
(2).note: References to other provisions should align with the version of the law applicable to the relevant year
